VI.iii.2.A.2.b
.
When Simultaneous Award Adjustments Are Not Permitted
Multiple award adjustments based on unrelated factual circumstances resulting in distinct legal transactions must be processed separately if the following is true:
at least one adjustment would create an overpayment, if processed by itself, and
another adjustment would increase benefits, if processed by itself.
This gives the beneficiary the right to either dispute/disagree with or request waiver of the full amount of the resulting debt before offset.
Important
:  Avoid postponing action on an actionable EP until action may be taken on multiple EPs.
Note
:
The term
before offset
means that if the award adjustment creating an overpayment and the award adjustment creating an increase are processed simultaneously
before
the amount of the resulting debt is put into the payment system for collection, VA recovers the overpayment created for the one issue with the increase or retroactive benefit created by the other.  In this case, the increase would
offset
the debt.
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section A - Simultaneous Award Adjustments
citation: Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section A
